posts.name: Luke Fehrenbacher
posts.cooked: My team was planning on using the max planetary system but with current supply chain issues they do not have the gear reductions we need. We designed some systems to use the female slot of the max system and are looking for some alternate solutions. Any ideas would be greatly appreciated!

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: AndyMark has the Sport series of planetary gearboxes: https://www.andymark.com/categories/single-speed-planetary-gearboxes

posts.name: Luke Fehrenbacher
posts.cooked: do they have a female coupling that I’m not aware of ?

posts.name: Lexeo
posts.cooked:
Looking to truly customize your Blue Sport Gearbox application? This 1/2 in. hex female output shaft allows you to use any length of 1/2 in. hex shaft you desire (or any shaft with a 1/2 in. hex end). Two 10-32 set screws are used to secure the shaft...

Is this what you are looking for?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Team 4272 Lead Mentor and Head Robot Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: Team 4272 Lead Mentor and Head Robot Mentor

posts.name: Ben Edwards
posts.cooked: Would a hex shaft coupler work, or does that introduce too much length?

posts.name: Luke Fehrenbacher
posts.cooked: Yes! I didn’t even know this existed.

posts.name: Mr. 1033
posts.cooked:
Highly recommend the Andymark system. Depending on the use and your team’s resources, I’ve seen teams make custom length outputs for their sport gearbox lines instead of using the female output adapter.

VexPro does have a kit that turns their versaplanetary systems into other outputs including a female end.

posts.name: Ben Edwards
posts.cooked: FWIW, we broke a Versaplanetary female hex shaft coupler last year on our climber arm.  The response from Vex was - don’t rely on it for shaft support, and don’t shock load it.  Generally good advice but it seemed less robust than the AndyMark or REV female shaft couplers since it’s 2 pieces.

posts.name: waialua3:59
posts.cooked: These are the Banebot ones IIRC.  Very robust, and never had issues with them in the past.

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked:
beedward:

broke a Versaplanetary female hex shaft coupler

We’ve broken one before as well.  The Rev output looks much, much more sturdy, and the adapter AM has also looks better as well!

We used the versa planetary adapter in the beginning last year and it was a pain to mount for our application. It didn’t fail but we did have one of the sun gears fail so we swapped over to max planetary and couldn’t have been happier. In my opinion i wouldn’t use the versa planetary female hex

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: My views are mine and mine alone

posts.custom_user_title: My views are mine and mine alone

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked: One thing I forgot to mention… shaft retention.  The Versaplanetary female adapter uses a set screw to retain the shaft, which in my experience can fail.  Rev’s, on the other hand, can be bolted in from the end before assembling, which should be much more secure.  I haven’t used AndyMarks, but it looks like it supports two set screws.  So probably more secure than the Versaplanetary, but not as secure as Rev’s.
